headline: Netflix taps bank to explore bid for Warner Bros Discovery
summary: (Reuters) -Netflix is actively exploring a bid for Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming business, retaining a financial advisor and gaining access to financial information, according to three sources familiar with the matter.  The video streaming service has hired Moelis & Co, the investment bank that advised Skydance Media on its successful bid for Paramount Global, to evaluate a prospective offer, two of the sources said.  Netflix also has been granted access to the data room, which contains the financial details needed to make a bid, according to two of the sources familiar with the matter.

content.title: Netflix taps bank to explore bid for Warner Bros Discovery
content.summary: (Reuters) -Netflix is actively exploring a bid for Warner Bros Discovery's studio and streaming business, retaining a financial advisor and gaining access to financial information, according to three sources familiar with the matter.  The video streaming service has hired Moelis & Co, the investment bank that advised Skydance Media on its successful bid for Paramount Global, to evaluate a prospective offer, two of the sources said.  Netflix also has been granted access to the data room, which contains the financial details needed to make a bid, according to two of the sources familiar with the matter.

headline: Comcast Stock Drops After Broadband Subscribers Fall for 10th Straight Quarter
summary: Comcast lost 104,000 subscribers from its crucial domestic broadband business in the third quarter.  Comcast still has the nation’s largest broadband business by subscriber count at 31.4 million, but it has been pressured since mobile carriers began to offer their own home-internet plans a few years ago.  “The broadband environment remains intensely competitive, which we do not expect to change any time soon,” said Mike Cavanagh, co-chief executive of Comcast.

content.title: Comcast Stock Drops After Broadband Subscribers Fall for 10th Straight Quarter
content.summary: Comcast lost 104,000 subscribers from its crucial domestic broadband business in the third quarter.  Comcast still has the nation’s largest broadband business by subscriber count at 31.4 million, but it has been pressured since mobile carriers began to offer their own home-internet plans a few years ago.  “The broadband environment remains intensely competitive, which we do not expect to change any time soon,” said Mike Cavanagh, co-chief executive of Comcast.

headline: Comcast, Stellantis, rare earth stocks: Trending Tickers
summary: Market Catalysts host Julie Hyman and Yahoo Finance senior reporter Allie Canal track several of the day's top trending stock tickers, including Comcast (CMCSA) issuing a warning on pressures surrounding its broadband subscribers, American automaker Stellantis (STLA) cautious on one-off costs for car companies, and rare earth metal stocks — Energy Fuels (UUUU), USA Rare Earth (USAR), and MP Materials (MP) — reacting to the details of the trade truce between the US and China. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Comcast Shares Slide as Broadband Subscriber Losses Continue
summary: Philadelphia-based Comcast shed 104,000 net broadband subscribers in the third quarter, though that was fewer than the loss of 140,000 predicted by analysts.  In the connectivity unit that includes broadband, Comcast’s biggest by far, revenue fell 1.4% and adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization declined 3.7%.  “The broadband environment remains intensely competitive, which we do not expect to change anytime soon,” co-Chief  Executive Officer Mike Cavanagh said Thursday on a call with investors.

content.title: Comcast Shares Slide as Broadband Subscriber Losses Continue
content.summary: Philadelphia-based Comcast shed 104,000 net broadband subscribers in the third quarter, though that was fewer than the loss of 140,000 predicted by analysts.  In the connectivity unit that includes broadband, Comcast’s biggest by far, revenue fell 1.4% and adjusted earnings before interest, taxes, depreciation and amortization declined 3.7%.  “The broadband environment remains intensely competitive, which we do not expect to change anytime soon,” co-Chief  Executive Officer Mike Cavanagh said Thursday on a call with investors.

headline: Comcast beats Q3 expectations as wireless growth offsets broadband losses
summary: Investing.com -- Comcast Corporation (NASDAQ:CMCSA) reported third-quarter earnings that exceeded analyst expectations, with adjusted earnings per share of $1.12, beating estimates by $0.02, while revenue reached $31.2 billion, surpassing the $30.7 billion consensus.

headline: Comcast’s (NASDAQ:CMCSA) Q3 Sales Beat Estimates
summary: Telecommunications and media company Comcast (NASDAQ:CMCSA) reported Q3 CY2025 results exceeding the market’s revenue expectations, but sales fell by 2.7% year on year to $31.2 billion. Its non-GAAP profit of $1.12 per share was 1.7% above analysts’ consensus estimates.

headline: Comcast Names Steve Croney CEO of Connectivity & Platforms, Succeeding Dave Watson, Who Will Become Vice Chairman of Comcast Corporation
summary: PHILADELPHIA, October 30, 2025--Comcast Corporation (Nasdaq: CMCSA) today announced that Steve Croney will be promoted to Chief Executive Officer of its Connectivity & Platforms division, succeeding Dave Watson on January 1, 2026. headline: Comcast Declares Quarterly Dividend
summary: PHILADELPHIA, October 30, 2025--Comcast Corporation (NASDAQ: CMCSA) announced that its Board of Directors declared a quarterly cash dividend of $0.33 a share on the company’s common stock. The quarterly dividend is payable on February 4, 2026, to shareholders of record as of the close of business on January 14, 2026.

headline: $329.71 Bn Spectator Sports Global Markets, 2025-2033 by Sports Type, Revenue Stream, Countries and Company Analysis
summary: The spectator sports market is projected to surge from USD 178.74 billion in 2024 to USD 329.71 billion by 2033, experiencing a CAGR of 7.04%. Key growth factors include expanding global sports appeal and technological advancements like VR and high-definition streaming. The market thrives on diverse revenue streams, including media rights and sponsorships, with growing interest in esports and women's sports. However, it faces challenges such as evolving consumer preferences and high event costs.

content.title: $329.71 Bn Spectator Sports Global Markets, 2025-2033 by Sports Type, Revenue Stream, Countries and Company Analysis
content.summary: The spectator sports market is projected to surge from USD 178.74 billion in 2024 to USD 329.71 billion by 2033, experiencing a CAGR of 7.04%. Key growth factors include expanding global sports appeal and technological advancements like VR and high-definition streaming. The market thrives on diverse revenue streams, including media rights and sponsorships, with growing interest in esports and women's sports. However, it faces challenges such as evolving consumer preferences and high event costs.
